thread.title: 'City Slickers' Billy Crystal and Daniel Stern Reunite for 'Westworld' Parody
thread.title_full: 'City Slickers' Billy Crystal and Daniel Stern Reunite for 'Westworld' Parody

title: 'City Slickers' Billy Crystal and Daniel Stern Reunite for 'Westworld' Parody
text:
'City Slickers' Billy Crystal and Daniel Stern Reunite for 'Westworld' Parody 1:20 PM PST 2/3/2017 by Ryan Parker Funny or Die 'City Slickers' meets 'Westworld' in Funny or Die skit. Sticking to the show's plot, the two old friends, Mitch and Phil, keep breaking their loop and have to be reset by park staff. 
Hell ? 
Billy Crystal and Daniel Stern reunited to bring their iconic City Slickers characters to life one more time in a hilarious parody of HBO's Westworld for Funny or Die. 
Sticking to the show's plot, the two old friends, Mitch and Phil, keep breaking their loop and have to be reset by park staff. 
The four-minute video also features cameos from the Westworld cast to kick things up a notch, including Luke Hemsworth and Ptolemy Slocum. 
Just as the hosts do in the HBO show, Mitch begins to malfunction, breaking his loop and Phil follows his lead because of course that's what Phil would do. 
Each loop ends with Mitch having enough of Phil and a gun is pulled, much like in Westworld . 
City Slickers came out in 1991 and a sequel, The Legend of Curly's Gold , was released in 1994.
